title: Behind the holiday lights, small businesses hustle to be at Snowport
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Business Vendors can pay over $27,000 in rent for their Snowport booth.
String lights hang over the vendor booths at the Snowport Holiday Market.
Madison Lucchesi/Boston.

title: Here’s what we know going into the start of Brian Walshe’s murder trial
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Opening statements will take place Monday, Dec.
1, with lawyers expecting the trial to last two to three weeks.
Brian Walshe appears in Norfolk Superior Court after pleading guilty to two of the three charges filed against him, Nov.

title: Payton Pritchard scores 42 as Celtics beat Cavaliers in a thriller: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics The only thing that was able to limit Pritchard in the first quarter was foul trouble.
Celtics' Payton Pritchard shoots as Cleveland Cavaliers' Darius Garland defends and Nae'Qwan Tomlin looks on during the second half.

title: More than 100 patients evacuated after Rockland nursing home fire
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News "The staff has been extremely cooperative, and they're probably really the true heroes, moving patients before we even got here.
” Crews responded to Webster Park Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center on Saturday night for a fire with heavy smoke.
Erin Clark/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Jeremy Swayman has his swagger back as Bruins franchise goalie
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “Just one shot at a time, brother.
" Jeremy Swayman has been the best netminder in the NHL in November.

title: Bill Belichick has a trademark terse press conference after UNC ends year with a loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Yeah, so we’re not gonna do a season recap.
I’m just finished with the game here.
" Bill Belichick and the Tar Heels closed out the 2025 season with a 4-8 record.

title: Maine man leads police on high-speed chase, allegedly rams police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime He was charged with operating under the influence, eluding an officer, reckless conduct, and criminal speed.

By Molly Farrar November 30, 2025 | 6:04 PM 1 minute to read A Maine man led police on a high-speed chase early Sunday morning that crossed state lines after he allegedly crashed into a New Hampshire State Police cruiser, authorities said.
Matthew Olsen, 44, of Harrison, was arrested on I-95 after driving over a curb at the Kennebunk Rest Area.

title: Patriots QB Tommy DeVito hopes New England blows out Giants on Monday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "When I was there, it was, ‘Go Giants’ but now it’s ‘Go Pats’ all the way.
" Tommy DeVito spent the last two seasons with the Giants.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan November 30, 2025 | 5:36 PM 2 minutes to read There appears to be no love lost between Tommy DeVito and his former team in the Giants.

title: Mass. lawmakers hold hearing on immigration bill that would ban police from asking about status
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The bill, known as the Safe Communities Act, was proposed in response to the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.
The proposed bill would implement several protections for immigrants in civil matters.

Erin Hooley/AP Photo By Darin Zullo November 30, 2025 | 11:28 AM 2 minutes to read Massachusetts lawmakers are considering a proposed law that would create new protections for immigrant communities in response to the Trump administration’s crackdown.
